Issues.Title: Content class doesn't use $title-family sass variable
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** 9.0.0

### Description

When customizing bulma using `$title-family`, the font family is changed for `.title` class, but not for `.content > h*` headers.

### Steps to Reproduce

- Change $title-family
- Use any h tag within a tag with `.content`

### Expected behavior

The font family to change accordingly.

### Actual behavior

The font family is not changed.

### Notes

This may be intentional behavior, but then maybe a `$content-heading-family` variable should be added ?

I got around adding this for now : 
```scss
@for $i from 1 through 5 {
    h#{$i} {
        @extend .title;
        @extend .is-#{$i}
    }
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Content class doesn't use $title-family sass variable" (#3039)

Issues.Title: Change sass-cli page from gem to Dart Sass?
Issues.Body:
This is about ** the Docs**.

I went through the tutorial on this page: [https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/with-sass-cli/](https://bulma.io/documentation/customize/with-sass-cli/)

Which is fantastic that it exists, because I am not a web-dev, and I really dislike yarn and npm,
and am thrilled to avoid them both. (mostly because I don't know them well)

But, going through it, installing the gem failed, and I ended up using Dart Sass,
which is the [primary implementation of Sass](https://sass-lang.com/dart-sass)

The issues with the gem are:
- installation doesn't go smooth on some systems (at least my Ubuntu 18.04)
- Dart Sass installs simply with an unzip & add to path
- Dart Sass is the primary implementation of Sass


I propose updating  the sass-cli page to use Dart Sass

I will do it, if the maintainers express interest in having a PR submitted for this small proposal.

I would do:
- add installation directions for Dart Sass on Linux (the Dart Sass directions are a little weak for beginners)
- remove gem install directions
- fix sass arguments format for Dart Sass ( `--sourcemap=none` has changed, etc...)
- fix `@import "../node_modules/bulma/sass/utilities/_all.sass";` lines to use correct or dynamic bulma version path like earlier in page



I really am thrilled with Bulma and this cli-based sass tutorial, so I wanna give a little love back. 


Thank you
Cameron
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Change sass-cli page from gem to Dart Sass?" (#3033)

Issues.Title: Overriding the $notification-padding variable only works when also overriding the notification-padding-ltr and notification-padding-rtl variables as well
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
<!-- My **browser** is: -->
This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [0.9.0]
<!-- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

It seems that adjusting the notification padding back to the default from previous versions of Bulma (I believe before 0.8.0 when all the paddings/margins changed w/ the larger form controls update) no longer works. I have customized Bulma quite a lot and have plenty of custom colors, variables and so on so I know my SASS file is working fine, but since upgrading to 0.9.0 I am unable to update the notification padding without also updating the variables for `ltr` and `rtl`. Should the ltr & rtl variables be derived perhaps? 
<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->


### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a sass file per the docs in order to customize Bulma
2. Override the `$notification-padding` variable, a la `$notification-padding: 0.375rem 0.75rem;`
3. Import Bulma as normal: `@import "~bulma/bulma";`
<!--
1. First Step
2. Second Step
3. and so on...
-->

### Expected behavior

Notification padding should be set to `0.375rem 0.75rem`
<!-- What you expected to happen -->

### Actual behavior

Notification padding remains at the default value in `~bulma/bulma/sass/elements/notification.sass`: `$notification-padding: 1.25rem 2.5rem 1.25rem 1.5rem !default`

This can be overcome by also overriding the other padding variables in this file, but this is not immediately clear to people who had adjusted it prior to the addition of the `ltr` and `rtl` variables:
```
$notification-padding: 0.375rem 0.75rem;
$notification-padding-ltr: 0.375rem 0.75rem;
$notification-padding-rtl: 0.375rem 0.75rem;
```
Perhaps it would be good to derive the `ltr` and `rtl` variables from the main one, or set a boolean to allow this just so we don't have to override all three. In writing up the details for this issue I figured out the solution, but I believe this should either be made clear or there might be an opportunity for an enhancement at least. Thanks!


<!-- What actually happened -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Overriding the $notification-padding variable only works when also overriding the notification-padding-ltr and notification-padding-rtl variables as well" (#3025)

Issues.Title: Default tablet breakpoints don't affect iPads
Issues.Body:
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 


### Description

Bulma's default tablet breakpoints do not work with iPads or iPad minis.

From the [docs](https://bulma.io/documentation/overview/responsiveness/), `tablet` refers to devices from 769px to 1023px in width. The trouble is — iPads and iPad Minis are 768px width in portrait, and 1024px width in landscape.

The breakpoint variables can be adjusted, but it seems odd to have defaults that don't work.

This issue was raised 3 years ago [here](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/1420), but the issue was closed.

### Steps to Reproduce

Use any tablet-specific responsive helper on an iPad or iPad mini, and it doesn't work.

Ex. `is-hidden-tablet-only`, `is-two-thirds-tablet`

[Here's a demo](https://bulmatablet--eri-b.repl.co/)

### Expected behavior

iPad or iPad Mini should respond to default Bulma responsive tablet helpers in both Portrait and Landscape mode.

### Actual behavior

iPad Portrait responds to Mobile helper, and iPad Landscape responds to Desktop helper.

<!-- What actually happened -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Default tablet breakpoints don't affect iPads" (#3019)

Issues.Title: Remove height auto from img (Fixes #342)
Issues.Body: This is a **bugfix** that solves the `img` tag problem from issue #342. The main problem is that the following html code doesn't work as expected. ```html ``` The expected is that the image would have 80px of height, but in order to get this behaviour it must be provided the height in CSS form. ```html ``` Which is not always convenient for instance when dealing with user provided html. This problem was caused by the following css style `img {height: auto;}`. ### Proposed solution It is just matter of removing the `height: auto` from `img` tag in: * `sass/base/minireset.sass` * `sass/base/generic.sass` ### Tradeoffs There is no alternative to this (removing the `height: auto` css), see this from StackOverflow: [remove height auto using css](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/44010645/remove-height-auto-using-css). Since `height: auto` means its height will be as minimum as possible to fit its children, which in this case is the image, this is already the standard behaviour. After this changes the `img` height will start obeying the `height` attribute when there is not CSS for `height`. ### Testing Done **Current behaviour** ![](https://i.imgur.com/mlh0EdX.png) **After changes:** ![](https://i.imgur.com/NDt9eqI.png) ### Changelog updated? No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove height auto from img (Fixes #342)" (#3015)

Issues.Title: Navbar Dropdown with "is-boxed" does not apply styles when Navbar is fixed bottom
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.0 My **browser** is: Firefox ### Description Navbar Dropdown `is-boxed` class does not apply when the Navbar has the `is-fixed-bottom` class. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Create a Navbar component with `is-fixed-bottom` class 2. Create a Navbar Dropdown with `is-boxed` class Example html: ```html
More
About Jobs Contact
Some random HTML
``` Add or remove `is-fixed-bottom` class from the `nav` element to see the difference in styles. ### Expected behavior The dropdown is rendered with the box styling as can be seen when it is fixed top: ![Capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23124945/85585601-09f9a180-b638-11ea-92e1-b28f61ff2991.PNG) ### Actual behavior The dropdown is rendered with the default styling, as seen here: ![Capture2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23124945/85585615-0d8d2880-b638-11ea-8f2a-1f38adb29d81.PNG)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar Dropdown with "is-boxed" does not apply styles when Navbar is fixed bottom" (#3014)

Issues.Title: Consider releasing SCSS files again
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem
This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**

### Description
Hello, we are considering migrating our project ([iTop](https://github.com/Combodo/iTop)) from Bootstrap to Bulma as it seems to be an awesome framework.

We are importing Bulma's .sass files in our own .scss files, which are then compiled using the SCSSPHP library. The problem is that our tools handle SCSS well but not SASS at all.

**As SASS and SCSS are pretty close, would you consider distributing SCSS files as well ?** I saw that you did a while back.

One of the users of Bulma is already distributing them in [its fork](https://github.com/j1mc/bulma-scss), he even gave the command to convert them. So it would be a minimum effort for you, as it could even be a GitHub action which would do it automatically on each of your commits.

Thanks for the great work and for considering this! 😻

Cheers 
Guillaume

### Steps to Reproduce
Not applicable

### Expected behavior
SCSS files distributed with SASS and CSS files

### Actual behavior
Not applicable
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Consider releasing SCSS files again" (#3013)

Issues.Body:

### Overview of the problem

I would like to control the spacing of the media object, but currently there are no variables for that. At least the docs does not mention any.

I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.0

### Description
I found that the [media.sass has two spacing related variables](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/4ccca9f7d45e4db58090783fef2c44c27488e0cb/sass/components/media.sass#L2-L3), but they do not have the `!default` marker, by adding it I could override them.

I'm very far from being an expert at aesthetics, so I do no know how wise to changing them in general, but adding more control over the media object might be useful for others as well.

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Media spacing" (#3012)
